answers.answer: Those are definitely high numbers in there, though you're right that there is a lot of up and down. I would definitely ask to see an endo as regular doctors aren't all that knowledgeable about diabetes. Best of luck to you. If it is diabetes your life and your son's life will change, no doubt. But what you do need to know is diabetes can be managed and diabetic complications prevented by good control, and technology to treat Type 1 diabetes is getting better all the time. Let me know by private message if you want a website where you can talk to other moms, maybe after you determine what is going on for sure.Zoe

question: I have a 2 1/2 year old son who woke up this past Monday morning shaking for about 30 min. then he ate and seemed fine.  Later he took a long nap and woke up shaking again.  Same thing Tuesday morning.  I took him to the doctor Tuesday after noon and his blood sugar level was 169.  So they wanted me to check his blood for times a day for a few days.  Here is what it has been:  Wed.:  wake up 169,  two after hrs. after brkfast 94, after nap 173, before bed 171.  Thur. same schedule:  64, 97, 100, 130.  Fri. same schedule:  75, 162, 117.  Called the numbers into the doctor he said, "seem to be something, not sure what.  I'll call a endo. and get back to next week."  I am a corcerned mom and would like some imput berfore next week.  I just don't understand why all the ups and downs.  Any help would be great.Concerned mom,G
title: Need some help understanding blood sugar levels
